metadata.title: CVE-2023-2513 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's ext4filesystem in the way it handled the extra inode size for extendedattributes. This flaw could allow a privileged local user to cause a systemcrash or other undefined behaviors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2513` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-generic - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-243-lowlatency - 4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1157-azure - 4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-243.277~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1157.172~14.04.2').
